pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmatā dabbena mallaputtena jātiyā sattavassena arahattaṃ sacchikataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.2.eng: Venerable Dabba the Mallian realized perfection at the age of seven.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.3.pli: Yaṃ kiñci sāvakena pattabbaṃ sabbaṃ tena anuppattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.3.eng: He had achieved all there is to achieve by a disciple

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.4.pli: Natthi cassa kiñci uttari karaṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.4.eng: and had nothing further to do.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.7.pli: Yaṃ kiñci sāvakena pattabbaṃ sabbaṃ mayā anuppattaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.8.pli: Natthi ca me kiñci uttari karaṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayo.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.9.pli: Kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ saṅghassa veyyāvaccaṃ kareyyan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.9.eng: he thought, “How can I be of service to the Sangha?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.10.pli: Atha kho āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa etadahosi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.11.pli: “yannūnāhaṃ saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeyyaṃ bhattāni ca uddiseyyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.1.11.eng: Why don’t I assign the dwellings and designate the meals?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.1.eng: In the evening Dabba came out of seclusion and went to the Buddha. He bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.2.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.3.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi mayā kho jātiyā sattavassena arahattaṃ sacchikataṃ, yaṃ kiñci sāvakena pattabbaṃ, sabbaṃ mayā anupattaṃ, natthi ca me kiñci uttari karaṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayo, kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ saṅghassa veyyāvaccaṃ kareyyanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.3.eng: “Sir, while I was reflecting in private, it occurred to me that I’ve achieved all there is to achieve by a disciple, and I was wondering how I could be of service to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.5.pli: ‘yannūnāhaṃ saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapeyyaṃ bhattāni ca uddiseyyan’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.5.eng: ‘Why don’t I assign the dwellings and designate the meals?’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.6.pli: Icchāmahaṃ, bhante, saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapetuṃ bhattāni ca uddisitun”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.8.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, dabba, saṅghassa senāsanañca paññapehi bhattāni ca uddisā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.2.9.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā dabbo mallaputto bhagavato paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.2.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ senāsanapaññāpakañca bhattuddesakañca sammannatu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.2.eng: “Monks, the Sangha should appoint Dabba the Mallian as the assigner of dwellings and the designator of meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.3.eng: And he should be appointed like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.5.pli: Yācitvā byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.5.eng: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.6.eng: ‘Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.7.pli: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṃ saṅgho āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ senāsanapaññāpakañca bhattuddesakañca sammanneyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.7.eng: If the Sangha is ready, it should appoint Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.9.eng: Please, venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.10.pli: Saṅgho āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ senāsanapaññāpakañca bhattuddesakañca sammannati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.10.eng: The Sangha appoints Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.11.pli: Yassāyasmato khamati āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa senāsanapaññāpakassa ca bhattuddesakassa ca sammuti, so tuṇhassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.11.eng: Any monk who approves of appointing Venerable Dabba as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals should remain silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.12.eng: Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.13.pli: Sammato saṅghena āyasmā dabbo mallaputto senāsanapaññāpako ca bhattuddesako ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.13.eng: The Sangha has appointed Venerable Dabba the Mallian as assigner of dwellings and designator of meals.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.3.14.eng: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.1.pli: Sammato ca panāyasmā dabbo mallaputto sabhāgānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.1.eng: Dabba assigned dwellings to the monks according to their character.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.2.pli: Ye te bhikkhū suttantikā tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.2.eng: He assigned dwellings in the same place to those monks who were experts on the discourses, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.3.eng: “They’ll recite the discourses to one another.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū vinayadharā tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.4.eng: And he did likewise for the experts on the Monastic Law, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū dhammakathikā tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.6.eng: for the expounders of the Teaching, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū jhāyino tesaṃ ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū tiracchānakathikā kāyadaḷhibahulā viharanti tesampi ekajjhaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.10.eng: and for the gossips and the body-builders, thinking,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.11.eng: “In this way even these venerables will be happy.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.12.pli: Yepi te bhikkhū vikāle āgacchanti tesampi tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā teneva ālokena senāsanaṃ paññapeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.12.eng: When monks arrived at night, he entered the fire element and assigned dwellings with the help of that light.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.13.eng: Monks even arrived late on purpose,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.14.eng: hoping to see the marvel of Dabba’s supernormal powers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.15.pli: Te āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ upasaṅkamitvā evaṃ vadanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.15.eng: They would approach Dabba and say,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.16.eng: “Venerable Dabba, please assign us a dwelling.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.17.pli: Te āyasmā dabbo mallaputto evaṃ vadeti—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.19.eng: They would intentionally suggest somewhere far away:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.20.pli: “amhākaṃ, āvuso dabba, gijjhakūṭe pabbate senāsanaṃ paññapehi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.22.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, isigilipasse kāḷasilāyaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.22.eng: “On Black Rock on the slope of Mount Isigili,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.23.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, vebhārapasse sattapaṇṇiguhāyaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.23.eng: “In the Sattapaṇṇi Cave on the slope of Mount Vebhāra,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.24.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, sītavane sappasoṇḍikapabbhāre senāsanaṃ paññapehi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.24.eng: “In Cool Grove on the hill at the Snake’s Pool,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.30.pli: Amhākaṃ, āvuso, maddakucchismiṃ migadāye senāsanaṃ paññapehī”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.31.pli: Tesaṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto tejodhātuṃ samāpajjitvā aṅguliyā jalamānāya purato purato gacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.31.eng: Dabba then entered the fire element, and with his finger glowing, he walked in front of those monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.32.pli: Tepi teneva ālokena āyasmato dabbassa mallaputtassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito gacchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.32.eng: They followed behind him with the help of that light.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.33.pli: Tesaṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto evaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapeti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.33.eng: And he would assign them dwellings:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.34.pli: “ayaṃ mañco, idaṃ pīṭhaṃ, ayaṃ bhisi, idaṃ bibbohanaṃ, idaṃ vaccaṭṭhānaṃ, idaṃ passāvaṭṭhānaṃ, idaṃ pānīyaṃ, idaṃ paribhojanīyaṃ, ayaṃ kattaradaṇḍo,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.34.eng: “This is the bed, this the bench, this the mattress, this the pillow, this the place for defecating, this the place for urinating, this the water for drinking, this the water for washing, this the walking stick;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.35.pli: idaṃ saṅghassa katikasaṇṭhānaṃ, imaṃ kālaṃ pavisitabbaṃ, imaṃ kālaṃ nikkhamitabban”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.35.eng: these are the Sangha’s agreements concerning the right time to enter and the right time to leave.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.35.comm: Idaṁ saṅghassa katikasaṇṭhānaṁ, imaṁ kālaṁ pavisitabbaṁ, imaṁ kālaṁ nikkhamitabbanti might be read as “These are the Sangha’s agreements, this is the time to enter, this is the time to leave,” thereby excluding the word “concerning”. In other words, although I have rendered it as such, it is not clear that there is a connection between them. Kd 18:1.2.22, however, makes it clear that the first phrase is to be read in conjunction with the following two.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.36.pli: Tesaṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto evaṃ senāsanaṃ paññapetvā punadeva veḷuvanaṃ paccāgacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.4.36.eng: Dabba then returned to the Bamboo Grove.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū navakā ceva honti appapuññā ca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.1.eng: At that time the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka were only newly ordained. They had little merit,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.1.comm: Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū can be read either as referring to two monks, Mettiya and Bhūmajaka, or as a group of monks led by these two. I have not been able to find any clear evidence that it refers to a group, and so I prefer the more straightforward reading that it only refers to the two monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.2.pli: Yāni saṅghassa lāmakāni senāsanāni tāni tesaṃ pāpuṇanti lāmakāni ca bhattāni.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājagahe manussā icchanti therānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ abhisaṅkhārikaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ dātuṃ sappimpi telampi uttaribhaṅgampi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.3.eng: The people of Rājagaha were keen to give specially prepared almsfood to the senior monks—ghee, oil, and special curries—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.4.pli: Mettiyabhūmajakānaṃ pana bhikkhūnaṃ pākatikaṃ denti yathārandhaṃ kaṇājakaṃ bilaṅgadutiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.4.eng: but to the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka they gave ordinary food of porridge and broken rice.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.5.pli: Te pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā there bhikkhū pucchanti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.5.eng: When they had eaten their meal and returned from almsround, they asked the senior monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.6.pli: “tumhākaṃ, āvuso, bhattagge kiṃ ahosi? Tumhākaṃ, āvuso, bhattagge kiṃ ahosī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.6.eng: “What did you get at the dining hall?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.8.pli: “amhākaṃ, āvuso, sappi ahosi telaṃ ahosi uttaribhaṅgaṃ ahosī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.8.eng: “We got ghee, oil, and special curries.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.9.eng: But the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.10.pli: “amhākaṃ, āvuso, na kiñci ahosi, pākatikaṃ yathārandhaṃ kaṇājakaṃ bilaṅgadutiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.5.10.eng: “We didn’t get anything except ordinary food of porridge and broken rice.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati saṅghassa catukkabhattaṃ deti niccabhattaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.1.eng: At that time there was a householder who gave a regular meal of fine food to four monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.2.eng: He made his offering in the dining hall together with his wives and children.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.3.pli: Aññe odanena pucchanti, aññe sūpena pucchanti, aññe telena pucchanti, aññe uttaribhaṅgena pucchanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.3.eng: Some of them offered rice, some bean curry, some oil, and some special curries.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino bhattaṃ svātanāya mettiyabhūmajakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ uddiṭṭhaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.4.eng: On one occasion the meal to be given by this householder on the following day had been designated to the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.5.pli: Atha kho kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati ārāmaṃ agamāsi kenacideva karaṇīyena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.5.eng: Just then that householder went to the monastery on some business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.6.pli: So yenāyasmā dabbo mallaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.6.eng: He approached Dabba, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.7.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho kalyāṇabhattikaṃ gahapatiṃ āyasmā dabbo mallaputto dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṃsesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.7.eng: And Dabba instructed, inspired, and gladdened him with a teaching.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.8.pli: Atha kho kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati āyasmatā dabbena mallaputtena dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṃsito āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.8.eng: After the talk, he asked Dabba,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.9.pli: “kassa, bhante, amhākaṃ ghare svātanāya bhattaṃ uddiṭṭhan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.9.eng: “Sir, who has been designated to receive tomorrow’s meal in our house?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.10.pli: “Mettiyabhūmajakānaṃ kho, gahapati, bhikkhūnaṃ tumhākaṃ ghare svātanāya bhattaṃ uddiṭṭhan”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.11.pli: Atha kho kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati anattamano ahosi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.12.eng: “Why should bad monks eat in our house?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.13.eng: After returning to his house, he told a female slave,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.14.pli: “ye, je, sve bhattikā āgacchanti te koṭṭhake āsanaṃ paññapetvā kaṇājakena bilaṅgadutiyena parivisā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.14.eng: “For those who are coming for tomorrow’s meal, prepare seats in the gatehouse and serve them broken rice and porridge.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.14.comm: “Gatehouse” renders koṭṭhaka. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.6.15.pli: “Evaṃ, ayyā”ti kho sā dāsī kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.1.eng: The monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said to each other,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.2.pli: “hiyyo kho, āvuso, amhākaṃ kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino bhattaṃ uddiṭṭhaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.2.eng: “Yesterday we were designated a meal from that householder who offers fine food.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.3.pli: sve amhe kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati saputtadāro upatiṭṭhitvā parivisissati;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.3.eng: Tomorrow he’ll serve us together with his wives and children.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.4.pli: aññe odanena pucchissanti, aññe sūpena pucchissanti, aññe telena pucchissanti, aññe uttaribhaṅgena pucchissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.4.eng: Some of them will offer us rice, some bean curry, some oil, and some special curries.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.5.pli: Te teneva somanassena na cittarūpaṃ rattiyā supiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.5.eng: And because they were excited, they did not sleep properly that night.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.6.pli: Atha kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya yena kalyāṇabhattikassa gahapatino nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.6.eng: The following morning they robed up, took their bowls and robes, and went to the house of that householder.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.7.pli: Addasā kho sā dāsī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū dūratova āgacchante. Disvāna koṭṭhake āsanaṃ paññapetvā mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.7.eng: When the female slave saw them coming, she prepared seats in the gatehouse and said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.10.pli: “nissaṃsayaṃ kho na tāva bhattaṃ siddhaṃ bhavissati. Yathā mayaṃ koṭṭhake nisīdeyyāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.10.eng: “The meal can’t be ready, since we’re given seats in the gatehouse.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.11.pli: Atha kho sā dāsī kaṇājakena bilaṅgadutiyena upagacchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.11.eng: She then brought them broken rice and porridge, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.13.eng: “But, Sister, we’ve come for the regular meal.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.15.pli: Api cāhaṃ hiyyova gahapatinā āṇattā— ‘ye, je, sve bhattikā āgacchanti te koṭṭhake āsanaṃ paññapetvā kaṇājakena bilaṅgadutiyena parivisā’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.15.eng: But yesterday I was told by the head of the household to serve you like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.18.pli: “hiyyo kho, āvuso, kalyāṇabhattiko gahapati ārāmaṃ agamāsi dabbassa mallaputtassa santike.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.18.eng: “Yesterday this householder came to the monastery and spoke with Dabba.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.19.pli: Nissaṃsayaṃ kho mayaṃ dabbena mallaputtena gahapatino antare paribhinnā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.19.eng: Dabba must be responsible for this split between the householder and us.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.20.pli: Te teneva domanassena na cittarūpaṃ bhuñjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.20.eng: And because they were dejected, they did not eat as much as they had intended.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.21.pli: Atha kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā ārāmaṃ gantvā pattacīvaraṃ paṭisāmetvā bahārāmakoṭṭhake saṅghāṭipallatthikāya nisīdiṃsu tuṇhībhūtā maṅkubhūtā pattakkhandhā adhomukhā pajjhāyantā appaṭibhānā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.21.eng: When they had eaten their meal and returned from almsround, they put their bowls and robes away and squatted on their heels outside the monastery gatehouse, using their upper robes as back-and-knee straps. They were silent and humiliated, their shoulders drooping and their heads down, glum and speechless.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.7.21.comm: For the rendering of saṅghāṭi as “upper robe”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.1.pli: Atha kho mettiyā bhikkhunī yena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.1.eng: Just then the nun Mettiyā came to them and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.5.pli: tatiyampi kho mettiyā bhikkhunī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.5.eng: and a third time she said

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.7.eng: but they still did not respond.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.10.pli: “Tathā hi pana tvaṃ, bhagini, amhe dabbena mallaputtena viheṭhīyamāne ajjhupekkhasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.10.eng: “It’s because we’ve been badly treated by Dabba the Mallian, and you’re not taking an interest.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.12.pli: “Sace kho tvaṃ, bhagini, iccheyyāsi ajjeva bhagavā dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ nāsāpeyyā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.12.eng: “If you like, you could make the Buddha expel Dabba.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.13.pli: “Kyāhaṃ, ayyā, karomi, kiṃ mayā sakkā kātun”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.14.pli: “Ehi tvaṃ, bhagini, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ evaṃ vadehi—

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.16.pli: Yāyaṃ, bhante, disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyaṃ disā sabhayā saītikā saupaddavā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.16.eng: There’s fear, distress, and oppression in this district, where none of these should exist.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.17.eng: From where one would expect security, there’s insecurity.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.18.eng: It’s as if water is burning.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.19.eng: Venerable Dabba the Mallian has raped me.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.19.comm: “Rapist” renders dūsita. See dūseti in Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.20.pli: “Evaṃ, ayyā”ti kho mettiyā bhikkhunī mettiyabhūmajakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.20.eng: Saying, “Alright, venerables,” she went to the Buddha, bowed,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.21.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho sā mettiyā bhikkhunī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.21.eng: and then repeated what she had been told to say.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.8.23.pli: Yāyaṃ, bhante, disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyaṃ disā sabhayā saītikā saupaddavā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Dabba:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.2.pli: “sarasi tvaṃ, dabba, evarūpaṃ kattā yathāyaṃ bhikkhunī āhā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.2.eng: “Dabba, do you remember doing as the nun Mettiyā says?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.5.pli: tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.5.eng: a third time the Buddha asked

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.6.pli: “sarasi tvaṃ, dabba, evarūpaṃ kattā yathāyaṃ bhikkhunī āhā”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.8.eng: He then said, “Dabba, the Dabbas don’t give such evasive answers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.9.eng: If it was done by you, say so;

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.10.eng: if it wasn’t, then say that.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.11.pli: “Yato ahaṃ, bhante, jāto nābhijānāmi supinantenapi methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevitā, pageva jāgaro”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.11.eng: “Since I was born, sir, I don’t recall having sexual intercourse even in a dream, let alone when awake.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.13.eng: “Well then, monks, expel the nun Mettiyā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.13.comm: “Expel” renders nāsetha. For a discussion of the verb nāseti, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.14.eng: and call these monks to account.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.15.pli: Idaṃ vatvā bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.15.eng: The Buddha then got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū mettiyaṃ bhikkhuniṃ nāsesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.16.eng: When the monks had expelled the nun Mettiyā,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.17.pli: Atha kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū te bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.17.eng: the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.20.pli: Amhehi sā ussāhitā kupitehi anattamanehi cāvanādhippāyehī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.20.eng: She was urged on by us. We were angry and displeased, and trying to get Dabba to leave the monastic life.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.21.pli: “Kiṃ pana tumhe, āvuso, āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.21.eng: “But did you groundlessly charge Venerable Dabba with an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.23.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.23.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.24.pli: “kathañhi nāma mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.24.eng: “How could the monks Mettiya and Bhūmajaka groundlessly charge Venerable Dabba with an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.25.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.25.eng: They rebuked those monks in many ways and then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned those monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.26.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.26.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.29.pli: “kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.29.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.31.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.31.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.32.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ duṭṭho doso appatīto amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya—‘appeva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyan’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.32.1.eng: ‘If a monk who is angry and displeased groundlessly charges a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, aiming to make him leave the monastic life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.33.pli: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā amūlakañceva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:1.9.33.eng: and then after some time, whether he is questioned or not, it is clear that the legal issue is groundless, and he admits to his ill will, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.8.eng: upset, dissatisfied, discontent, having hatred, hostile.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.10.pli: tena ca kopena tena ca dosena tāya ca anattamanatāya tāya ca anabhiraddhiyā appatīto hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.10.eng: because of that upset, that ill will, that dissatisfaction, and that discontent, he is displeased.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.12.eng: not seen, not heard, not suspected.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.16.eng: accuses him or has him accused.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.17.pli: Appeva nāma naṃ imamhā brahmacariyā cāveyyanti
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.17.eng: To make him leave the monastic life:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.18.pli: bhikkhubhāvā cāveyyaṃ, samaṇadhammā cāveyyaṃ, sīlakkhandhā cāveyyaṃ, tapoguṇā cāveyyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.18.eng: to make him leave the monkhood, leave the state of a monastic, leave his morality, leave the virtue of monasticism.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.20.pli: yasmiṃ khaṇe anuddhaṃsito hoti taṃ khaṇaṃ taṃ layaṃ taṃ muhuttaṃ vītivatte.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.20.eng: the moment, the instant, the second after he has laid the charge.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.22.pli: yena vatthunā anuddhaṃsito hoti tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ samanuggāhīyamāno.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.22.eng: he is questioned about the grounds of his charge.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.24.eng: he is not spoken to by anyone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.26.pli: cattāri adhikaraṇāni— vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.26.eng: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.27.eng: And he admits to his ill will:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.28.pli: tucchakaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, musā mayā bhaṇitaṃ, abhūtaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, ajānantena mayā bhaṇitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.28.eng: “What I said was empty,” “What I said was false,” “What I said was unreal,” “I said it without knowing.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.29.eng: He commits an offense entailing suspension:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:2.30.eng: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.1.eng: Although he has not seen it, he accuses someone of having committed an offense entailing expulsion:

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.2.pli: Tañce codeti—“diṭṭho mayā, pārājikaṃ dhammaṃ ajjhāpannosi,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.2.eng: “I’ve seen that you’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.3.eng: You’re not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.4.pli: natthi tayā saddhiṃ uposatho vā pavāraṇā vā saṅghakammaṃ vā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss8:3.1.4.eng: You’re excluded from the observance-day ceremony, from the invitation ceremony, and from the legal procedures of the Sangha.”
